column4: Microsoft unveils Windows 10 S for its Surface laptops
column5: Microsoft Corp on Tuesday unveiled Windows 10 S  a streamlined version of its popular operating system  geared toward low-cost laptops for students  as it tries to take share from Google's Chrome OS-run computers.

column4: Microsoft unveils Windows 10 S for its Surface laptops
column5: May 2 Microsoft Corp on Tuesday unveiled Windows 10 S  a streamlined version of its popular operating system  geared toward low-cost laptops for students  as it tries to take share from Google's Chrome OS-run computers.

column4: Tencent steps up AI push with research lab in Seattle
column5: HONG KONG Chinese social media and gaming giant Tencent Holdings said on Tuesday it will open an artificial intelligence (AI) research facility in Seattle in the United States  to be led by former Microsoft scientist Yu Dong.

column4: Tencent steps up AI push with research lab in Seattle
column5: HONG KONG  May 2 Chinese social media and gaming giant Tencent Holdings said on Tuesday it will open an artificial intelligence (AI) research facility in Seattle in the United States  to be led by former Microsoft scientist Yu Dong.

column4: Tesla executives listed as officers at materials recycling firm
column5: Two top Tesla Inc  executives were listed as officers at a materials recycling company  Redwood Materials Inc  indicating possible ties between the companies. | Video

column4: Tesla is most painful stock for short sellers in 2017
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Traders short selling Tesla's  soaring stock have lost $3.7 billion this year  eclipsing the combined losses of traders   shorting Apple   Amazon.com  and Netflix .

column4: Tesla executives listed as officers at materials recycling firm
column5: May 2 Two top Tesla Inc executives were listed as officers at a materials recycling company  Redwood Materials Inc  indicating possible ties between the companies.

column4: EU to rule on $38 bln Qualcomm  NXP deal by June 9
column5: BRUSSELS EU regulators will decide by June 9 whether to clear smartphone chipmaker Qualcomm's $38 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors NV  with rivals voicing concerns about continued access to key NXP technology after the deal.

column4: EU to rule on $38 billion Qualcomm  NXP deal by June 9
column5: BRUSSELS EU regulators will decide by June 9 whether to clear smartphone chipmaker Qualcomm's  $38 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors NV   with rivals voicing concerns about continued access to key NXP technology after the deal.

column4: EU regulators to rule on $38 bln Qualcomm  NXP deal by June 9
column5: BRUSSELS  May 2 EU antitrust regulators will decide by June 9 whether to clear smartphone chipmaker Qualcomm's $38 billion bid for NXP Semiconductors NV   which would make it the leading supplier to the fast-growing automotive chips market.
